(b)  Authorization. The board exists by the authority of the McIntosh County Commission and may be modified or abolished by action of the county commission. 
(Ord. of 10-11-2011, art. I) 
Sec. 8-202. - Purpose and function. 
(a)  Purpose. The board is an advisory board to the county commission, appointed by the county commission, in support of the McIntosh County Animal Shelter (hereafter referred to as animal shelter). 
(b)  Function. For this purpose, the board shall: 
(1)  Assist in the development of animal shelter's mission and policies; 
(2)  Review and recommend long range planning and budgeting for animal shelter services; 
(3)  Provide research, guidance, advice, sponsor reports and contribute information relevant to animal shelter's program development, policies and procedures; 
(4)  Serve as liaisons to the community, increasing support and awareness of animal shelter services and assisting in the resolution of citizen concerns, issues, and grievances. 
(Ord. of 10-11-2011, art. II) 
Sec. 8-203. - Membership. 
(a)  Members. The board shall be comprised of seven members appointed by the county commission. 
(b)  Eligibility. 
(1)  Members of the board shall be county or city residents. 
(2)  The county may choose to appoint members of Hart to the board. 
(c)  Appointments. 
(1)  Term of office shall be for two years. Members shall not serve more than two consecutive terms. 
(2)  Appointments to the board shall be made by the county commission, who will receive letters of interest from those wishing to apply. 
(d)  Vacancies/removal. 
(1)  A member's position shall become vacant when the board chair determines that: 
a.  A member is absent from 33 percent of the regularly scheduled meetings in a given calendar year, regardless if such absence is excused or unexcused. All absences will be duly recorded in the meeting minutes. Absences from emergency or special called meetings will not be recorded against a member in calculating the percent of absences. Special exceptions on the removal of members for absences may be made by the board chair when the absences are due to health or time-limited extenuating circumstances and the absences do not affect the ability of the board to maintain a quorum; or 
b.  A member's term expires; or 
c.  A member resigns. 
(2)  The board chair shall immediately, upon receipt of a resignation or determination of a vacancy, notify the county clerk. 
(Ord. of 10-11-2011, art. III) 
Sec. 8-204. - Organization. 
(a)  Officers. 
(1)  The board shall elect a chair, vice-chair, and a secretary. 
(2)  Officers shall be elected for a term of one year at the first meeting of the year. Vacancies shall be filled by a majority vote of the board at which a quorum is present. 
(3)  The chair, or, in his absence, the vice-chair, shall preside at all meetings of the board. 
(b)  Duties. 
(1)  Chair. 
a.  The chair shall preside at all meetings of the board, call special meetings, draft and send correspondence and otherwise perform all duties incident to the office of the chair and all other duties which may be prescribed by the board. 
b.  The chair shall appoint chairs of all committees, standing and special. 
c.  It is the chair's responsibility to ensure compliance with the policies and procedures manual. The chair will notify members of removal from board for noncompliance with the policies and procedures manual's requirements. Specific questions of conflict of interest will be addressed by the county attorney or his designee. 
d.  The chair shall immediately, upon receipt of a resignation or when advised of a vacancy, notify the county clerk. 
e.  The chair may approve special exceptions on the removal of members for absences at regularly scheduled meetings when the absences are due to health or time-limited extenuating circumstances and the absences do not affect the ability of the board to maintain a quorum. 
f.  The chair may attend county commission meetings as deemed appropriate by the board. 
(2)  Vice-chair. The vice-chair shall perform the duties in the absence of the chair and will also perform such duties as shall be assigned by the chair. 
(c)  Quorum. A majority of the board shall constitute a quorum to hold a meeting or take any action, including election of officers. The officers of the board shall be elected by a majority of the board members present, provided a quorum is present at such meeting. 
(d)  Voting rights. 
(1)  Each member shall be entitled to one vote and shall cast that vote on each item submitted. Proxy votes and absentee ballots shall not be permitted. Members shall only abstain from a vote when there is a valid conflict of interest addressed to the board. 
(2)  Board members shall avoid conflicts of interest while serving on the board. 
a.  Conflicts of interest occur when a member makes a decision which may affect their personal financial interests. Therefore, members are prohibited from participating in the decision making on issues which inures to his or her special private gain or loss, or which would insure the special private gain or loss, or which would insure the special gain or loss of any principal by whom he or she is retained. 
b.  Board members are required to publicly disclose their conflicting financial interests, since the disclosure process reminds all members of their obligation to put the public interest above personal considerations. If a conflict is unknown or not disclosed prior to the meeting, the board member must disclose the conflict at the meeting when the conflict becomes known. 
(Ord. of 10-11-2011, art. IV) 
Sec. 8-205. - Board operations. 
(a)  The board shall have no authority other than as stipulated by the policies and procedures manual and approved by the county commission. 
(b)  The board will meet routinely based upon an adopted meeting schedule, at least quarterly, and will notice all meeting in the legal organ. 
(c)  All meetings will be open to the public. For advertising purposes, the board will provide to the county clerk a schedule of meetings. 
(d)  Special meetings of the board may be called by the chair, or at the request of a majority of board members. The time and place of any special meeting shall be designated by the chair or the board members calling the meeting. The purpose of the meeting will be stated to the board members, and except in cases of emergency, at least three days' notice shall be given each member of a special meeting. Special meetings may be held by the utilization of telephone conference or other similar telecommunication device. The procedures applicable to regular meetings shall govern the conduct of special meetings. 
(e)  All meetings shall be conducted in accordance with the latest edition of Robert's Rules of Order. 
(f)  The board may establish committees, as needed, composed of board members and non-board members, for the purpose of supporting the board. 
(1)  Standing committees, intended to perform various functions to be determined by the board, serve year-round. 
(2)  Ad hoc committees may be established for a specific short-term goal and then cease to exist. 
(3)  Committees will submit a written report to the board chair at the end of the assigned project. 
(4)  The board chair shall appoint each committee's chair. 
(Ord. of 10-11-2011, art. V) 
Sec. 8-206. - Staff services. 
(a)  The animal shelter department shall consist of staff appointed by the county manager or his or her designee and shall assist the board and the county manager in the following manner: 
(1)  Maintaining the minutes of the meetings; preparing and distributing appropriate information related to the meeting agenda. 
(2)  Informing the board of events, activities, policies, programs, etc., occurring within the scope of the board's function and informing the board of all county commission or department requests for information or assistance. 
(3)  Ensuring the county clerk is informed of all vacancies, expired terms, changes in officers, or any other changes to the board. 
(4)  The responsibility for continuous flow of information to the county manager, and when appropriate, to the county commission, including providing reports, actions, and recommendations of the board. 
(b)  A formal, standard orientation program will be provided by staff to all new members; the program will address, but not be limited to, the policies and procedures manual, and conflict of interest. Staff will ensure responses are provided to any concerns the new members may have regarding the duties and responsibilities of the board and the members. 
(Ord. of 10-11-2011, art. VI) 
Sec. 8-207. - Policies and procedures manual and effective date. 
Any changes to the policies and procedures manual will be reviewed and approved by the board and the county commission and filed first with the office of the county manager for review. 
(1)  The policies and procedures manual shall become effective upon adoption by the county commission and the board. 
(2)  The policies and procedures manual may be amended at any regular meeting by a majority vote of the membership provided that the amendment(s) has (have) been submitted in writing at the previous regular meeting and provided that they are subsequently approved by the county commission. 
(Ord. of 10-11-2011, art. VII) 
Chapter 10 - BUILDINGS AND BUILDING REGULATIONS[1] 
Footnotes:
